title: All Leisure warns on profits owing to ‘difficult trading conditions’
text:
Save 
All Leisure Group has reduced its seasonal losses by 23% but warned that geopolitical events are likely to “continue to impact the business adversely” 
The cruising and escorted touring company reported an operating loss for the six months to the end of April of £11.8 million, down from £15.2 million in the previous year. 
The company lost 32 cruising days in the period because of dry-dock maintenance on both its Minerva and Voyager ships. 
Events in Syria led to a dampening of demand for escorted tours in nearby Turkey. All Leisure is also suffering from the conflict in Ukraine, which is affecting cruising in the profitable Black sea area. 
Coupled with problems in its destinations, the Aim-listed firm is also suffering from foreign currency transaction losses. 
Roger Allard, executive chairman of All Leisure, said: “I am pleased to report that the seasonal losses for the first half year have been reduced, despite the dry-dock periods for both Voyager and Minerva, which reduced available sailing time.” 
But he added: “With the company continuing to experience these difficult trading conditions, the board anticipates that full-year performance will be below expectations and now expects the business to make a small loss for the full year.”
